entry.title: How GitHub does take home technical interviews
entry.summary: We believe our technical interviews should be as similar as possible to the way we work at GitHub.

entry.title: GitHub Copilot now available for Visual Studio 2022
entry.summary: GitHub Copilot is now available from Visual Studio 2022 for everyone in the technical preview.

entry.summary: Advice on fundamentals, picking languages to learn, social media presence, interviewing, and more

entry.title: How to secure your end-to-end supply chain on GitHub
entry.summary: Securing your projects is no easy task, but end-to-end supply chain security is more top of mind than ever. We’ve seen bad actors expand their focus to taking over user accounts, commonly used dependencies, and also build systems. Defending against these attacks is hard, because there’s no one thing you can do to protect your […]

entry.title: Unlock all the GitHub secrets within .Tech Domains newest experience: Break The Code 2!
entry.summary: GitHub Education is fired up for the return of .Tech Domains developer community competition: Break The Code 2. We've hacked in some new enigmas, cheat codes, and easter eggs for digital sleuths to uncover!

entry.title: An update on recent service disruptions
entry.summary: Over the past few weeks, we have experienced multiple incidents due to the health of our database. We wanted to share what we know about these incidents while our team continues to address them.

entry.title: GitHub Actions: secure self-hosted runners by limiting them to specific workflows
entry.summary: You can now enforce consistent usage of self-hosted runner groups across your organization and enterprise.

entry.title: Improving your GitHub feed
entry.summary: Today, we are rolling out a new beta version of GitHub’s home feed, making it easier to discover projects, developers and more across GitHub.

entry.title: Introducing the GHES repository cache
entry.summary: If you're a GHES customer with heavy read traffic on your monorepo, check out the repository cache, especially if you have CI workloads distributed around the world.

entry.title: Start working on GitHub Issues faster
entry.summary: You can now create a branch to work on an issue directly from the issue page so that it's easier to get started right away.

entry.title: A Proposal For Type Syntax in JavaScript
entry.summary: Today we’re excited to announce our support and collaboration on a new Stage 0 proposal to bring optional and erasable type syntax to JavaScript. The post A Proposal For Type Syntax in JavaScript appeared first on TypeScript.
